SEARCH
Package com.visionreport.core.models

Class MediaModel

java.lang.Object
com.visionreport.core.models.MediaModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class MediaModel extends Object implements Serializable
Internal data model representing a fully processed media item (screenshot, visual artifact, or file preview) within the Vision Report.

Each instance is presentation-ready and serializable for template rendering. This class contains a Base64-encoded representation of the content and an optional descriptive title for display within the report UI.

Design Intent

  • Immutable and thread-safe.
  • Does not perform any I/O or encoding logic â€” handled externally by com.visionreport.core.engine.MediaUtil.
  • Used internally by the report generator after processing user-supplied media.

Example (internal usage):


 MediaProvider provider = MediaProvider.fromFile("screenshots/login.png");
 MediaModel model = MediaUtil.toMediaModel(provider);
 // model.getBase64() => "data:image/png;base64,..."
Since:
1.0
Version:
2.0
Author:
Deepak

      public MediaModel(String base64, String title)
      Constructs a new immutable MediaModel instance.

      base64 - Base64-encoded content, already prefixed with MIME type (cannot be null)
      title - Optional descriptive title (nullable)

    • getBase64

      public String getBase64()
      Returns the Base64-encoded media data.

      Example: data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0K...

      Returns:
      Base64-encoded string suitable for HTML embedding (never null)

    • getTitle

      public String getTitle()
      Returns the human-readable title or label for this media item.
      Returns:
      title string (may be empty but never null)

    • hasMedia

      public boolean hasMedia()
      Returns whether this model contains valid Base64 media content.
      Returns:
      true if Base64 data is non-empty; false otherwise
